name: Emotional Intelligence
description: Guardian Ideal-aligned EQ drills for flight commanders and crew leads.

cards.title: Guardian Ideal Values Check-In
cards.description: Lead a weekly huddle where each teammate shares how they lived Character, Connection, Commitment, and Courage. Ref: Guardian Ideal (2021).
cards.summaryText: Values stick when leaders ask about them out loud.

cards.title: Emotion Labeling Rehearsal
cards.description: Practice describing emotions with precision before tough conversations so intent stays clear. Ref: OTS Leadership Curriculum.
cards.summaryText: Clear labels reduce defensiveness in feedback moments.

cards.title: Crucial Conversation Prep
cards.description: Use the USAF Crucial Conversations model (start with heart, master my stories, state path) before counseling sessions. Ref: OTS Leadership Guide.
cards.summaryText: Deliberate prep keeps hard talks productive instead of explosive.

cards.title: 360Â° Listening Drill
cards.description: Host five-minute listening rotations, paraphrasing teammate inputs without rebuttal to strengthen trust. Ref: Guardian Resilience Program.
cards.summaryText: Listening muscles need reps just like technical skills.

cards.title: Stress Signal Inventory
cards.description: List personal stress tells (tone, posture, habits) and share with your deputy so they can help you course-correct. Ref: Guardian Ideal Appendix A.
cards.summaryText: Leaders who name their stress cues catch them sooner.

cards.title: Assume Positive Intent Drill
cards.description: Before replying to an email/text, rewrite the sender's message assuming positive intent to reduce reactive tone. Ref: Guardian Leadership Playbook.
cards.summaryText: Guardians move faster when miscommunications stay small.

cards.title: Recognition Cadence Plan
cards.description: Schedule consistent micro-recognition (handwritten notes, shoutouts) tied to Guardian Ideal behaviors. Ref: USAF Profession of Arms Center guidance.
cards.summaryText: Recognition feeds morale when it is specific and steady.

cards.title: Conflict Temperature Gauge
cards.description: Teach teams to rate disagreement heat (green/yellow/red) so they know when to pause. Ref: Guardian Resilience Training.
cards.summaryText: Shared language keeps debates from devolving into fights.

cards.title: Empathy Mapping
cards.description: Use the empathy map (says, thinks, does, feels) before mission changes that affect crews. Ref: Guardian Ideal toolkit.
cards.summaryText: Empathy is a planning tool, not a buzzword.

cards.title: Psychological Safety Retro
cards.description: Run retros using OTS's four-question template: what worked, what lacked clarity, what risks felt safe, what to improve. Ref: OTS Instruction 36-2011.
cards.summaryText: Psych safety requires deliberate rituals, not slogans.

cards.title: Mentorship Map
cards.description: Chart who mentors you and whom you mentor, ensuring diversity of perspective per Guardian Ideal guidance. Ref: Guardian Ideal.
cards.summaryText: Healthy mentorship ecosystems prevent leader burnout.

cards.title: Resilience Resource Drill
cards.description: Practice introducing chaplain, mental health, True North, and Military & Family Life resources so stigma stays low. Ref: Guardian Resilience Framework.
cards.summaryText: Leaders who share resources early make it easier for Guardians to seek help.
